text: In a photographic DARKROOM: old optical enlargers, porcel trays, timers, and stills hanging out to dry. GEORGE MATLIN, a slightly obese, nearsighted man in his  seventies.
Is he real? Oh yeah -- Absolutely.
Super: CPL. GEORGE MATLIN, combat photographer.
I haven't talked about it for years,  you know? (looks at the camera) Everyone called me crazy...
Matlin smiles as he paws through a box of old negatives.
But I have the negative.
Someone turns on the darkroom's red safety light for an e dramatic effect.
Get ready, 3-2-1... Roll tape.
It all started back in  44. I was a  Corps photographer aboard an allied  submarine...

YOUNG MATLIN's hands again paw through a bunch of negativ again under a red light. Now, at 21, he's wedged in a  submarine corridor, a crowded maze of pipes and gauges. 35mm still cameras dangle from his neck. He shrinks back a squad of MARINES hustles past him, loading weapons.
...off the coast of Scotland.  Classified mission. I was 21...
SGT. WHITMAN, 44, tough as nails, pushes through, his uni soaked in sweat.
We had an English civilian on board.  Not much older than me but already  an advisor to President Roosevelt.  "Paranormal" advisor, I kid you not --
Whitman continues down the passageway until he reaches a  small...
Within, an incongruously proper young Englishman "reading an ancient set of Tarot cards.
His name was Trevor. Profesor Trevor --
-- Broom! Topside, now.
TREVOR "BROOM" BRUTTENHOLM is a gaunt, olive-skinned man his late twenties. In his hands, a tarot deck. He turns t cards face up: THE FOOL, THE MOON...
The sooner we're done, the better.
Broom grabs a worn-down wooden box full of books and amul It has a leather strap that allows him to carry it, much  like a carpenter's tool box.
This is an important mission, Sgt.  Whitman. I hope you realize that.
Oh -- you don't wanna know what I  think. Topside, now.
He moves away. Broom takes a small box and a few amulets. Before exiting, he pauses and tensely turns the last TARO CARD: THE DEVIL.
Super: OCTOBER 9, 1944, SCOTLAND. It's raining like hell now. Soldiers move through a short tunnel carved into the mountain. Whitman signals his men to spread out, then comes alongsi Broom.
Sgt. Whitman!! Sgt. Whitman!! May I  have a word??
(impatient) What is it?
In private, if you don't mind...
They enter the remains of a small chapel. Broom produces small box. It's full of rosaries.
Your men -- They'll need these --
Whitman scowls and huffs. A life-sized wooden Christ  contemplates the scene from above.
You are a Catholic??
Amongst other things, yes -- but  that's hardly the point.
Whitman locks and loads an automatic.
Here. You'll need one of these.
I abhor violence. (Whitman moves away) Sergeant Whitman, I hope you don't  think me mad --
Three days too late for that one,  "professor."
He moves away. Broom looks up to the wooden Christ: It ha no eyes.
MATLIN hauls his tripod and gear and joins the troops on move. Broom catches up with Whitman.
You're wasting our time: There's  nothing on this island but sheep and  rocks.
Ruins. Not rocks. The remains of  Trondham Abbey. Built on an  intersection of Ley Lines, the  boundaries between our world and the  other --
(interrupts him) What a load of crap. Hell, a week  ago I hadn't even heard the word  parabnormal --
"Paranormal" (Whitman moves on) But -- you read the transmission.
Half transmission. Nonsense -- German  ghost stories!
I have seen ghosts, Whitman.
Oh, I'll bet you have.
Reaching a slope, Matlin sets down his camera. Turning, h sees lights.
Sweet Jesus.
Drenched, Broom and Whitman look down upon an impressive  ROMANESQUE RUIN. Under worklights, dozens of NAZI SOLDIER swarm among thick stone walls and archways.
They must be here for the sheep.
A dozen German soldiers swiftly assemble a large steel  MACHINE. The work is monitored by a spindly Nazi in BLACK LEATHER, his face covered by an odd gas mask: KROENEN.
The freak in the gas mask --
Karl Ruprecht Kroenen, one of the  Reich's top Scientists. Head of the  Thule Occult Society.
He lowers a pair of binoculars and passes them to Whitman
If he's here, this is worse than I  thought.
(to the radio man) Air and sea backup. What's closest?
The RADIOMAN cranks a transmitter to life.
Londonderry, sir. Forty minutes away.
We don't have forty minutes.

Kroenen throws a switch: On the machine, dozens of gears  respond! Steam pistons thrust copper rails upright, lifting two mi metal rings, not unlike a gyroscope. Kroenen grunts and  signals for more floodlights to be turned on.
The lights flood an ancient sacristy lined with eroded st saints. GRIGORY, tall and gaunt, stands naked, arms fully extended.
No matter what happens to me, you  must carry on with the work.
ILSA, a severe, ageless Aryan beauty, reverentially drape an embroidered robe over his bony shoulders.
I will not leave you.
Yes, you will... Leave me. Deny me.
Never --
He hands her a small LEATHER-BOUND BOOK. It contains hand drawn notes and illustrations.
This will guide you back to me.
He pulls her close, the clouds of their breath mingling.
I grant you everlasting life, youth  and the power to serve me.

He dips his fingers in a wooden bowl full of blood, then  wipes her tears away with a crimson thumb, both a consola and a ritual. VON KRUPT, an acrid German General, wearing dark SCARLET  glasses and LEATHER GLOVES, appears. Looks at his pocket  watch. On the gold lid: a SWASTIKA.
It's time.
Grigory walks towards the machine, its colossal steel and copper clockworks gleaming in the floodlights.
Five years of research and  construction, Grigory. Five years!!
He strides alongside Grigory and Ilsa, who holds an umbre to shield her master from the pouring rain.
The furhrer doesn't look kindly on  failure.
There will be no failure, General. I  promised Herr Hitler a miracle. I'll  deliver one.

Kroenen mutters excitedly as he opens a polished oak box  containing a massive gold and copper MECHA-GLOVE. Grigory extends his hand so that KROENEN may fit him with the contraption, which is attached to cables and hoses.
The Americans fan out, unseen. Broom and Whitman dive into a ditch barely in time to avo a German foot patrol. Other GI's take up positions below a machine gun nest.
Grigory walks to the top of the altar, cables trailing be him.

Tonight, We will open a portal and  awaken the OGDRU JAHAD: The seven  Gods of chaos. (beat) Our enemies will be destroyed. In an  instant, all impurity in this world  will be razed and from the ashes a  new eden will arise.
He looks down at the machine and whispers --
Ragnarok, Anung Ia Anung.

He flexes his fingers and in response -- -- the two metal rings swing around the machine's central axis. TCHINK!!! WHIRRR!!! STEAM escapes from the ducts an pipes. An invisible blast of energy forces the falling ra to swerve momentarily away from Grigory's body. Ilsa signals TWO NAZI SCIENTISTS standing at a control pa
More Power!! Don't let the level  drop!!
One of them inserts a 20 inch SOLID GOLD CYLINDER into th machine. Two openings remain vacant next to it. A blade of light opens in the air! Burning symbols slash the air, like living serpents of fi
The edges of the cosmic slit sizzle with color; an ALIEN  GALAXY sparkles on the other side. Suddenly, a work light tears loose and flies in.

The six-foot work light tumbles by the massive OGDRU JAHA seven egg-like monoliths of unholy origin. Within their translucent walls, horrible creatures lie  slumbering. As the light sweeps by, one of the giants ope a filmy eye, and then another, and another, and another.. Fleshy tentacles move lazily within their crystalline pri
Grigory screams as his body rises. Veins swell in his nec his face distorted by ecstasy and pain. CLICK. Someone shoots a photograph.
It's Matlin, snapping for all he's worth. Whitman pulls h down and pulls out a large bayonet blade.
Listen to me, you moron: you do that  again, I'll carve you a new --
Too late. One of the NAZI SCIENTIST has heard them.
The Nazi SCIENTIST approaches. Pauses next to the box wit the GOLD CYLINDERS.
(fierce whisper, to
Listen to me!!! The portal is open!!!  We have to stop them!!!

Grigory dangles like a marionette in a new surge of energ Even the skeptical Von Krupt is in thrall. The NAZI SCIENTIST reaches for a second GOLD CYLINDER. Bu something else lands next to him: A GRENADE!!! The explosion blows him to pieces. In a few seconds, the  squad of Allies storms the area. A hail of bullets cuts down a dozen Nazis. The Allies ove the machine gun nest as grenades explode everywhere. VON KRUPT shoots wildly, hitting Broom in the leg. But  Whitman's bullets rip into the old Nazi's chest. Leaving a trail of blood, Broom crawls to a dead G.I. and grabs a grenade from his belt. TCHKKK!!! Kroenen extends two gleaming blades from twin s bands on his wrists and takes on an entire group of soldi mowing through them with swords spinning like deadly roto The steel chops clean through their weapons. Broom pulls the pin and throws the grenade at the generat CLICK-CLACK!! It wedges itself between two moving tie rod Kroenen squeals and -- retracting his blades -- lunges af it. The gyrating rails slice through his leather jacket. his fingers reach the grenade, it EXPLODES!!! Kroenen flies through the air, hitting a stone wall, wher two long pieces of shrapnel pin him like an insect. Another rail plunges -- FFFFT!!, like a javelin -- into t earth right next to MATLIN.
Grigory!

Grigory's face is distorted, pulled like ectoplasmic taff his body contorting and breaking. The cosmic portal sudde implodes! Nothing is left but a few burnt rails and the m glove, empty and smoking. As the Allies approach, the fighting rages on. Grigory and Ilsa are gone. And for now, so is Kroenen.  Embedded in the wall where he was pinned, two bloody rail nothing more.
Allied SOLDIERS penetrate the ruins. Matlin helps Broom u
It's almost over!!
No. It's not.
He picks up a sample of white, viscous goo from the outer rings of the smoking machine. Whitman approaches.
Cordon off the area. Something came  through.
From where??!!
Broom glances at a 13th century FRESCO depicting heaven a hell.
Still raining. A group of soldiers spreads out, using  flashlights to scour through the rubble. Every one of the has a rosary hanging from the bayonet.
Broom hastily bandages his bleeding leg. Matlin and Whitm roam over the debris. Rain POURS through the broken roof.
Do you believe in hell?
There is a place -- a dark place  where evil slumbers and awaits to  return. From there it infects our  dreams. Our thoughts. Grigory gave  us a glance tonight --
Grigory -- That's Russian, right? (Broom nods) Thought they were on our side...
Grigory Yefimovich Rasputin --
C'mon -- Rasputin??
Spiritual advisor to the Romanovs. (beat) In 1916, at a dinner in his honor,  he was poisoned, shot, stabbed,  clubbed, drowned and castrated.
That makes him more than a hundred --

A rustling sound reaches their ears. Matlin readies a han as Broom scans the walls with his flashlight. Something m accompanied by a loud scrape. Matlin cocks his pistol and nervously approaches a crumbl statue. SCREEEECH!!!! A RED THING jumps into the air!!  Instinctively, Matlin shoots at it. The RED THING leaps from arch to arch, followed by a trai of bullet hits. Whitman and other soldiers join them --
(to Broom) What the hell was that? An ape?
No. It was red. Bright red.
What are you two talking about??
A red ape.
It's-not-an-ape --
They hear the labored breathing of a living creature.
It's got a big stone -- in its hand --
I think that is its hand.
Hissing, the thing cowers between a gargoyle and a stone  saint. WHITMAN points his gun at the scarlet shape above. Broom  stops him from firing.
Wait --

In deep shadow, the RED THING observes with bright, golde eyes veined with streaks of burnt sienna. Broom slowly fishes a BABY RUTH candy bar from his pocket Peeling back the wrapper, he slowly waves the candy. The THING shrinks back. Broom bites into the candy and chews, noisily smacking hi lips. Offers the candy again. This time, out of the dark  comes a small FACE, not very different from the stone dem around it. The creature extends its right arm: it's solid stone with tiny runes engraved around the thick, cylindrical wrist.  Four articulated stone fingers wiggle, reaching for the  chocolate.
Jesus! would'ya look at the size of  that whammer!
Whitman moves closer. On the wall behind him, a shadow sh the RED THING climbing into Broom's arms. Broom tenderly covers it with a blanket. The stubby finge snatch the candy. Broom smiles.
It's a boy. Just a baby boy.

The soldiers cluster around, curious to see it. Matlin  prepares his camera and directs them into a group shot. B smiles like a proud new father and embraces the creature, patting him gently. CLICK!!!
Best photo of my career --
and no one has ever seen it. They  keep saying he's not real, but I  want to set the record straight before  I go.
Matlin finally pulls an old 8x10 from a battered portfoli He smiles, full of memories.

Here. The real picture, not the  retouched one in LIFE magazine. (hands over the  photograph) This is him. The very same night we  found him. The night Broom gave him  that name. (beat) Can I say it on TV? He called him --
(smiles at the creature) HELLBOY.
Inside the blanket, Hellboy blinks his bright golden eyes and chews candy, his devilish red tail twitching happily.

Montage: Tabloid covers and news clippings screaming HELL SIGHTING IN RENO!! GOVERNMENT DENIAL!!! etc. TV Newscasters read lurid copy. SPRINGER excerpts (fist f included) feature the show's theme: I WAS HELLBOY'S BRIDE Some blurry, grainy footage depicts Hellboy crossing an a Much like Bigfoot in the woods.
Look at that. That's a costume. These  people amaze me.
MANNING is a balding, official-looking guy in a suit.
With their conveniently blurry footage  of their beloved "Hellboy." And they  claim that he works for the FBI-?
Manning on a TV SHOW a la Regis Philbin.
As the head of your division, you --  You have seen dozens of pictures  like this!!!
Exactly -- so, why is it that they're  all out of focus? C'mon!! God knows,  people manage to get good pictures  at a wedding!!
He shows a blurry picture.
That's the alleged best man -- ?
The audience applauds.
In the thick of a snowstorm, THREE FIGURES climb the icy  steps of a massive rock formation. Super: BIRGAU PASS, MOLDAVIA, PRESENT DAY.

The THREE FIGURES move through a narrow passage until the reach a DEAD END. FIGURE 1 stops at a symbol carved in the rocky ground and consults Grigory's LEATHER-BOUND BOOK. The symbol matches illustration in the book. Before them, a thick wall of ice. Using a heavy steel ham FIGURE 1 breaks through.
I will guide you no further.
Figure 2 produces two small GOLD INGOTS. Hands one to the guide. Keeps the other one. The Guide examines his pay greedily: engraved in it: a  SWASTIKA.
The ice curtain collapses, revealing a rough-walled corri FIGURE 1 spots a glowing firefly. They follow it into --

A cathedral-like vault that could easily hold a stadium.  From an opening somewhere above, eerie blue light streams down on a magnificent labyrinth. A few more fireflies speckle the air, winking on and off.
The THREE FIGURES move past cyclopean statues guarding th inhuman architecture. The humans are dwarfed by the monum scale of the walkways and ramparts.
At the center of the labyrinth the stone floor is covered grooves radiating from a shallow stone basin. FIGURE 3 uncovers his face: he's a PEASANT GUIDE.
(in Romanian) We shouldn't be here --

FIGURE 1 exchanges a meaningful look with FIGURE 2. FIGUR throws two solid gold pieces at the feet of the Sherpa. O them, an embossed SWASTIKA. After a greedy moment of thou the Peasant kneels to pick up the gold. TCHKK!!! A long, shiny blade pierces the Peasant's chest  from behind. He blinks twice and slumps forward. FIGURE 2 steps out from behind him, a long, bloody blade his hand. The figures uncover their faces. ILSA has not aged and  KROENEN, still wears the same tight gas mask. He cleans h blade in the snow and takes back the gold. Ilsa watches the Sherpa's blood as it runs in a steaming  rivulet, tracing a glyph in the grooves and filling the b A FIGURE RISES FROM THE BLOOD. A naked human shape, haloe by fireflies.
Your eyes. What did they do to your  eyes?
Mechanized rollers transport X-Ray films over a backlit  screen. A group of 4 DOCTORS studies the pictures and  exchanges somber looks. Rain spatters the windows. Doctor 1 glances at the others.
Have you told him yet?
Doctor 2 looks through a glass partition at an aged but  dignified BROOM, 72, who slowly buttons his shirt. Hangin from his wrist, his rosary.
Malignant sarcoma. In the lungs...  the spine, liver...
Approximately... how long??
Maybe -- six weeks.
Broom impassively takes in the information.
I can arrange for hospitalization,  pain management. Make the time more  bearable --
Broom pensively shuffles his tarot cards.
(shakes his head) I'd rather... stay home, you know.  I'll be making arrangements -- (beat) For my son.
You can always get a second opinion.
Broom looks down: first card off the deck: DEATH.
That won't be necessary.

Leaves stir on the pavement. All the stores are decorated for Halloween. Two kids dressed as SKELETONS run in front Broom, carrying a JACK-O-LANTERN. Leaning on a cane, Broom exits the building and walks tow a waiting black Mercedes. The DRIVER (Agent Lime) opens t door. Broom pauses to buy a dozen BABY RUTH candy bars from a s vendor. In an ELECTRONICS STORE, a wall of TV's. The image of a R BLURRY SHAPE (HELLBOY) fills the screens.
(seeing this) Son...
Mister Manning, what about the "Bureau  for Paranormal Research and Defense?"  The FBI has been known to conceal --
That word -- conceal --
from the American public --
Phil -- Phil -- hold your little  green horses. Let me tell you and  the American public one thing --  this "Bureau for -- what was it?
Paranormal Research and --
-- Defense, right, well -- I'm here  to clear up this once and for all. (he looks at the camera) There-is-no-such-thing.
Broom smiles.
On a wooded, new jersey hill, a low-slung, high-tech comp rests at the edge of a bluff, its foundation fused with t rock below.

A dolled-up MOD-STYLE moped stops at the massive gate.  Strapped to the luggage rack are two cheap suitcases. The driver, a very wet YOUNG MAN named MYERS, touches an old  fashioned buzzer under a sign reading "WASTE MANAGEMENT" A crackling INTERCOM VOICE answers.
Yes?
(shivering) John Myers, F.B.I. Transfer from  Quantico.
A beat, then -- WHIRRR!!! An EYEPIECE and an LCD screen  scanner pop out.
Look at the birdie, son.
Myers looks into the eyepiece. On the screen, Myers' corn is scanned. TWO VIOLET FLASHES. His ID and badge numbers  appear. CLACK! The gate opens.
The moped putt-putts towards the building in the distance
Seated at a dramatic circular desk is a solitary guard. M approaches.
Hello, I'm --
-- Late. Five minutes late.
Yes, I --
-- Section fifty-one. Step back.
Pardon?
Two steps back, please.
Confused, Myers picks up his suitcases and complies. He  realizes he's DEAD CENTER on a giant B.P.R.D. Logo: A HAN HOLDING A SWORD.
Watch your hands and elbows.
Immediately, the floor under Myers' feet starts down. He' on a small elevator.
The panel overhead slides shut. A row of safety lights co on.
He's in a vast underground area with other elevators movi up and down in the distance.

The elevator stops in a narrow, dark space. Neon lights  flicker on, illuminating a circular chamber. PAINTED on t floor is a huge number: 51. Right in front of Myers: a magnificent oak door. Myers knocks on it. No answer. Myers enters.

Myers looks around, fascinated: books. An office made of  them. The soft glow of green-shaded reading lamps bathes  everything in an intimate, warm light. One entire wall is a thick pane of glass, the wall of a h tank of water. A VOICE crackles through an intercom next the tank.
Turn the pages, please.
Myers jumps, then moves closer to the glass.
Over here... if you don't mind?
In the tank, ABE SAPIEN, a FISH-MAN glides in and out vie
Jesus Christ!

Myers looks at four BOOK STANDS facing the glass. Each  supports an open volume. He leans close to the glass, pee intently. Abe reappears. He is slender, dolphin gray, with dark pat streaking his soft skin. Bright blue eyes shine with  intelligence. Behind a thin wound-like mouth, gills are  bubbling.
(points at the books) These -- ? You're reading these -- ?
Abe nods. Through a side door, Broom enters.
Four books at once. Every day -- as  long as I'm here to turn the pages. (smiles) My name's Broom. Professor Trevor  Broom.
Myers extends his hand in greeting --
Sir, I'm --
BAM! Abe presses his webbed hand against the glass, close his eyes -- all three lids. Abe's voice surges from the speaker.
Agent John T. Myers, Kansas City,  76. "T" stands for Thaddeus, mother's  older brother. Scar on your chin  happened when you were ten, you still  wonder if it's ever going to fade  away.
How did it --
-- He. Not "it."
Abraham Sapien. Discovered alive in  a secret chamber at St. Trinian's  Foundling Hospital, Washington.
Points at a small piece of antique paper, framed on the w
They took his name from this little  inscription that was stuck on his  tank.
(reads) Icthyo Sapiens, April 14, 1865.
The day Abraham Lincoln died. Hence  "Abe" Sapien.
Broom uncovers a tray by the tank: Four greenish eggs. My gags and reels back.
Rotten eggs, a delicacy. Abe loves  them.
Abe smiles and takes a subaquatic bow, gracefully nabbing the eggs as they float through the hatch.
How does he know so much about me?
Abe possesses a unique frontal lobe. (beat) "Unique." That's a word you'll hear  quite a bit around here.
Where am I -- exactly, Sir?
As you entered the lobby there was  an inscription --
On the desk, yes. In Latin.
Impressive. Do you remember what it  said?
(sighs) "In absentia luci, tenebrae  vinciunt..."
"In the absence of light, darkness  prevails." For there are things that  go bump in the night, Agent Myers. (smiles) We are the ones who bump back.
Myers and Broom walk down a corridor. The walls are lined with glass cases containing occult artifacts. Myers eyes MUMMIFIED HAND, a CLAY GOLEM, a sumptuous PAGAN ALTAR...
1937: Hitler joins "The Thule Society" --  a group of German aristocrats obsessed  with the occult.
He points to an ANCIENT, BROKEN LANCE.
1938: he acquires the Spear of  Longinus, which pierced the body of  Christ. He who holds it becomes  invincible.
He gestures at an ancient LANCE. Next to it: a silver and gold reliquary.
Hitler's power increases tenfold.
They go through a series of pneumatic doors.
In 1943, President Roosevelt decides  to fight back. THE BUREAU FOR  PARANORMAL RESEARCH AND DEFENSE is  born.
Workmen are replacing two of the doors. Big dents from an oversized fist have deformed the 2-inch thick metal plate Myers stares.
1958, the occult war finally ends  when Adolf Hitler dies.
1945, you mean. Hitler died in '45.
(enigmatic smile) Did he, now?
They reach a FINAL DOOR. Stainless steel, like a BANK VAU Waiting there is AGENT CLAY, a burly guy in a suit, with cartful of BEEF AND MASHED POTATOES. A dinner pile at lea 4 feet high.
Agent Myers, this is Agent Clay.  Follow his lead.
Broom hands Myers two BABY RUTH bars and walks away.
You're not coming?
Broom signals "no."
I hand-picked you from a roster of  over seventy academy graduates. Make  me proud.
The door closes behind him.
They're not speaking. Professor Broom  had him grounded.
Grounded? Who's grounded?
Okay. You saw the fish man, right?
Myers nods.
Well, come on in and meet the rest  of the family.
Clay uses an odd-shaped ELECTRONIC KEY to unlock the door Three solenoid locks turn. Two steel vertical PISTONS ope up.

Clay pushes the cart into a solid concrete bunker, window austere except for a few SAMURAI suits of ARMOR and WEAPO Dozens of CATS wander around; others are curled up on the furniture. There are Zippo's everywhere, from every era. On a sofa (made from the bed of a pickup truck) is a heap blankets and comic books. All in all, a MEGA BACHELOR PAD
(sotto voce) He gets fed six times a day. He's  got a thing for cats. You'll be his  nanny, his keeper, his best friend.  He never goes out unsupervised --
Who?!

Clay points at a torn comic book: HELLBOY, THE UNCANNY. M picks it up, looks at the cover: it shows Hellboy -- in a U.S. Uniform, fighting a monstrous ape. Myers watches, amazed, as a bright red TAIL waves in and of a pool of light about ten feet away. One of the cats  playfully paws at it.
(sotto voce) You're kidding --
Those comics -- They never got the  eyes right.
The voice is a deep baritone, chesty and powerful.
(to Clay, sotto voce) Oh, Jesus!! Hellboy -- ?? Is real --
(sotto voce) Yup. Sixty years old by our count.   But he doesn't age like we do --  think dog years: He's barely out of  his teens.
Myers gasps, seeing a monumental figure in the shadows,  exercising with a 300 lb. Stainless steel DUMBBELL. Crims biceps like cooked hams. Chomping an unlit CIGAR stub.
What's with the hair, Clay?? Finally  got those implants??
Agent Clay blushes as he hides his scalp.
It'll fill in. Where do you want  your dinner, Red? By the couch?
On a nearby pile of junked TV sets, a loop of Fleischer  cartoons and home movies cycles endlessly. One subject ap over and over: an ATTRACTIVE YOUNG WOMAN with a pale face and raven-black hair.
Who's the squirt?
Agent Myers is your new liaison.
Got tired of me?
Nah. I'll be around, Red, just back  in the field.
BANG!!! Hellboy lets the dumbbell drop. Instinctively, My jumps.
I don't want him.
Manning says I'm too soft on you -- (sotto voce, nudging  Myers) The candy. Give him the candy.
Myers remembers he's holding the Baby Ruths.
Oh. Uh. Hello. I -- I have these.  For you.
(realizing) Father's back? (Clay nods) Still angry?
Well, you did break out --
I wanted to see her. (grunts) It's nobody's business.
It is. You got yourself on TV again.
"Myers", huh? You have a first name??
(sotto to Myers) Try not to stare. He hates when people  stare.
Uh-oh -- John. (sotto) Staring at what?
His horns. He files 'em. To "fit  in."
His what??!!

Hellboy finally enters the light. He's awe-inspiring, wit chiseled features, patterned red skin and deep-set golden eyes. Involuntarily, Myers recoils. In spite of himself, Myers is staring at the horn stumps.
Whatcha looking at, John??
Oh-n-no -- I --
An ALARM sounds, and a red light blinks on the wall. Myer looks around, bewildered.
(to Clay) Hey, hey, hey. They're playing our  song.
We're on the move.
(to Myers) C'mon, Champ! Happy Halloween!!!  You're taking me for a walk!

An imposing four-story structure, all pillars and pedimen A HALLOWEEN BANNER advertises: MAGICK: THE ANCIENT POWER. Super: THE MACHEN LIBRARY, MANHATTAN  Chaos near the entrance: policemen, TV reporters, MOUNTED POLICE. Loud protests from the reporters as a line of black sedan cars are waved through.
The NYPD has yet to issue a statement.  We've got SWAT vans, paramedics, you  name it...  and now here's -- a  garbage truck -- (double take) -- a garbage truck?
Trailing behind the cars, a GARBAGE TRUCK. On its side a  mirrored sign reads: SQUEAKY CLEAN INC. Waste Management  Services.
AN AGENT is driving the truck, with MYERS at his side.
The crowd parts like the Red Sea for the garbage truck. D of faces are reflected in the truck's mirrored logo. A MO POLICEMAN rides past the mirrored sides of the truck.

The MOUNTED POLICEMAN is visible as he rides by. The mirr are see-through. The back of the truck is a fully-equippe crime lab, crammed with hi-tech gear and low-tech talisma ABE fits a respirator over his face. It looks like a  mechanized Elizabethan collar. Valves bubble and hiss as inhales liquid through his mouth and out his gills.  Hellboy looks out onto the CROWD.
Look at them ugly suckers, Blue. One  sheet of glass between them and us.
